title: Is Not Null
text:
TIL
It‚Äôs true, I had an MS Access Question. I could not figure out my Is Not Null criteria was not working. This post explained it what was happening and way to resolve it.
```{sql, eval= FALSE}
Len([Name_Full] & ‚Äú‚Äú)=0



In my case, I wanted to exclude the null values



```{sql, eval = FALSE}
Len([Name_Full] & "")>1


Fin

title: Command Line
text: Here is a fun video/content on using the command line. Command Line. Good stuff with ls command and navigation.

title: playing
text:
This is a helpful post from Thomas Mock about how to write a function to automate blog post. Thus far, I have truly missed my blogdown addin.
Maybe I should try to write my own addin. I manged to get an addin in place but does not work. I need to feed the function arguments.

title: SQL Form
text: ALTER TABLE <table_name> ADD COLUMN <column_name> <DATA_TYPE> <CONSTRAINTS>;

title: SQL Form
text: ALTER TABLE <table_name> ADD COLUMN <column_name> <DATA_TYPE> <CONSTRAINTS>;

title: SQL Form
text:
Add column to a table
ALTER TABLE <table_name> ADD COLUMN <column_name> <DATA_TYPE> <CONSTRAINTS>;

title: Today I learned
text: How have I not run into the problem of filtering multiple values. I was running through some scripts but could not find the solution.

title: Today I learned
text: How have I not run into the problem of filtering multiple values. I was running through some scripts but could not find the solution.

title: Today I learned
text:
Solution:
I am pretty sure I found this on a stack overflow post
dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(outcomes, 'something1|nextitem2|anotherthing3')) 
It worked and write this to remember!

title: Goals
text:
‚ÄúWe are creative because we ship the work‚Äù
- Seth God: The Practice page 102.

I am still lacking in direction but have settled to focus in on html/css. I can do some html but it is not second nature. I am going to be working through this course. I enjoy the structure of courses in that it helps you develop muscle memory.
I wanted to play with Docker but every time I start docker desktop it freezes my computer. I need to set some boundaries with Digital Ocean and setting up Droplets and work on Shiny Proxy.

title: File-Paths
text:
Not that file paths come up in polite conversations.

I had forgotten about the article but it was recently brought up on the Standard Deviations podcast.


Hilary is giving out questionable career advice in the latest episode of @NSSDeviations.To launch the segment, we‚Äôre discussing: How do you know if a company has a good data science culture?https://t.co/SuRQDaQBlj

‚Äî Roger D. Peng (@rdpeng) October 29, 2021


Excluding people I have met at an R-user group, I know two people who understand file paths.

title: Fun with Readme & Github Actions
text: I have been focused on github actions and gitlab pipelines for about two weeks, and I stumbled upon this cool post. Not only is there good content on Github Actions, but content and script for the README is awesome. In addition, numerous posts on using automated workflows and other awesome content.

title: To make upper case
text: I needed to make the values in a column consistent and was struggling to add in the base R function of toupper in a dplyr pipeline. I found the str_to_upper(string, locale = "en") function in the stringr package and made it work.

title: Mutating for Good
text:
I could not figure out how count the values in a column and pivot the same column in Google query function. You can do this with a Pivot Table report builder but I hate the output.
To resolve the issue, I made a new column based on the targeted column and was able to obtain the desired output-a Stackoverflow post gave me the idea.

title: Impact of AI
text:
Here is a link to an insightful podcast about the potentials and pitfalls of AI.
A guest, Emily Bender a professor at the University of Washington points out that it is not really AI. Chat-GPT is language model that is really good at prediction of what comes next and summary. I believe she was making the argument that the OpenAI was engineering Chat-GPT to make it seem like the product has intelligence and giving it human like qualities.

title: One down
text:
I finished the html portion of the Web Design course today. I spent about 2 hours over the last two days working on it. I want to be sure to reflect on what I learned from these courses and not just buzz through them.
News things I learned included the following html elements:

figure
figcaption
fieldset

Anchoring links and images is still a struggle and form elements is still a struggle. I look forward to the courses that focus on forms.

title: Back to Gitlab
text:
Full stop, I prefer Gitlab!

I started shifting to using Github mainly because of the usethis package
I am thankful the folks at ThinkR have picked up the development of the gitlabr package. I really liked the ability to pull down and create issues directly from R.

title: Submodules
text:
Don‚Äôt forget the ns!

I was trying to incorporate submodules into my Shiny Application. When I ran my application it was drawing blanks, but I don‚Äôt recall if there was an error message in the console.
This stack overflow post helped me figure it out. Nothing complicated‚Äì I just forgot the ns values in my submodules as well.
Here is some additional resources on namespacing

title: Domain Expertise
text:
Introduction
It is very cool when someone articulates a sense you have brewing beneath the surface.


I‚Äôm on a tech centered biz team and we do lots of exploration using technical tools to figure out how to solve biz problems. Then pro devs turn our code into prod. Too few shops have tech centered biz folks then they wonder why wrong stuff gets built. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è https://t.co/WpclQkj1Ys

‚Äî JD Long (@CMastication) October 3, 2021


In a less formal fashion, this is how my shop works‚Äìmy issue is that I am knee deep in the business process and doing the data exploration.
This is my process

Hey, I can query this‚Äìcan you make this pretty?

A couple of days ago I replied with this tweet to a question.


This is where domain expertise ‚Äòshines‚Äô. I shine when I have a sense for what is important and what program staff need to do their jobs. I flail with layout and structure when I am not sure what is helpful.

‚Äî Kevin Gilds (@Kevin_Gilds) September 30, 2021




Conclusion
Different but closely related.

title: Across
text:
I made that more difficult than it had to be.

I was working on analyzing twenty plus survey questions and wanted to use the forcats function collapse on all of them. I was desperately trying to combine dplyr::across with the forcats function collapse.
Thankfully, I found this Stackoverflow Post
library(dplyr)
library(forcats)
df %>% 
    mutate(across(-pid, ~ fct_collapse(.,
     yes = c('y', 'Y'), no = c('no', 'NO', 'n'))))
     
My mistake was that I was trying to close the across function paren too soon and hence errors. Here is an example of one way I was doing it wrong.
library(dplyr)
library(forcats)
df %>% 
    mutate(across(-pid), ~ fct_collapse(.,
     yes = c('y', 'Y'), no = c('no', 'NO', 'n'))))
     

Conclusion
I am hoping that digging into the reason for this trouble helps me remember for next time.
